result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Robert Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Restitution is plus any additional amount that may be requested in the next 60 days by the prosecution.
Submit and pay for DNA sample.
Jail term is with huber privileges.
Submit to psychological assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment.
Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.

Submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.
May not possess or consume alcohol.

timeConds.notes: Jail term is to commence within 14 days from 10-01-15.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Robert Scott

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Plea and sentencing and Initial appearance on 10-01-15

9:00 am - 14CF87 & 15CF48 - Defendant Brandon Robert Scott appeared with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states recommendation. DA certifies victims rights compliance.  DA moves to amend 14CF87 to 940.19(1) Misd. A - Battery and 15CF48 to 946.49(1)(a) Misd. Bail Jumping.  So ordered. DE pleads GUILTY to 14CF87 and NO CONTEST to 15CF48.   Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Complaint acknowleged and reading waived of complaint in 15CF48.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC in 14CF87 & 15CF48.  Comments by parties. Comments and ruling by Court. Appeal rights given. Adj. 9:36 am. 

Court imposes:
14CF87 - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation. 
Conditions:
$250 fine
$200 DNAAS
Submit DNA sample
45 day jail term, with huber privileges, to commence within 14 days from 10-01-15, with credit for time served
Apology
$7194.52 + 10% surcharge restitution, plus any additional restitution that may be requested in the next 60 days by prosecution
AODA
May not possess or consume alcohol
Submit to psychological assessment and follow through


15CF48 - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation.
Conditions:
$243 court costs
$65 SBDA
AODA
May not possess or consume alcohol
Submit to psychological assessment and follow through

9:30 am - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Brandon Robert Scott appeared with attorney Stephen D. Willett.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No motions filed.  Discussion of admissability of statements.

10:29 am - Defendant Brandon Robert Scott appeared with attorney Stephen D. Willett.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have previously received and reviewed information. DE pleads NOT GUILTY to charges. Adj. 10:29 am.

9:02 am - Defendant Brandon Robert Scott appeared with attorney Stephen D. Willett.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Comments by defendant and Attorney Willett regarding non-appearance at previous hearing.  Court vacates warrant.  Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing form.  Court finds waiver is given freely and accepts. Adj. 9:04 am.

9:31 am - Defendant does not appear.  Attorney Stephen D. Willett appeared.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Comments by Willett regarding waiver of preliminary hearing and non-appearance.  Attorney Willett files waiver of preliminary hearing form.  Court orders warrant of $750 + $25WF and holds issuance until 9:00 am 04-13-15. Adj. 9:35 am.
plea of not guilty and demand for a twelve person jury trial

Defendant Brandon Robert Scott appeared with attorney Stephen D. Willett.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Bond to continue.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.  Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.    DE may not have contact with Tyler Armstrong, unless there is written consent on file.  DE shall NOT consume alcohol.
